---
slug: /127
title: "This Week In React #127: Nextra, React-Query, React Documentary, Storybook, Remix, Tamagui, Solito, TC39, Rome..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 12-06-2022
---
Hi everyone!
We have some nice articles this week. I liked to discover how React-Query is implemented, or the latest Storybook news.

segments.source_content: Nextra v2 is a serious challenger for Docusaurus!
A nice React documentary is being created, and the trailer is available ğŸ™Œ
It's also quite active on React-Native side! There are some great releases, a State of React-Native survey in the works.
For this edition, I put the images below the title/text, don't hesitate to tell me if it's better like that or if you prefer above?

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor1}
[![FlyCode Makes React Apps Editable without coding, Git based](/emails/issues/124/flycode.jpg)](https://bit.ly/3UPwAoJ)
**[FlyCode Makes React Apps Editable without coding, Git based](https://bit.ly/3UPwAoJ)**

[FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) makes React web apps editable in minutes so Product and UX teams can iterate and release products faster, so they don't have to wait on (or consume) developer time.

translations.zh-hant: [FlyCode](https://bit.ly/3wWSi00) (YC S22) èƒ½åœ¨å¹¾åˆ†é˜å…§è®“ React ç¶²é æ‡‰ç”¨ç¨‹å¼è®Šå¾—å¯ç·¨è¼¯ï¼Œä½¿ç”¢å“å’Œ UX åœ˜éšŠèƒ½æ›´å¿«è¿­ä»£å’Œç™¼å¸ƒç”¢å“ï¼Œç„¡éœ€ç­‰å¾…ï¼ˆæˆ–ä½”ç”¨ï¼‰é–‹ç™¼è€…æ™‚é–“ã€‚

segments.source_content: FlyCode reads your regular React code and finds Texts, Images, Design tokens and Analytics event, then it let's non-coders collaborate and edit them and send back a pull request (they don't need access to GitHub!)

- Saves development time
- No code integration, it just reads your code!
- GitHub based, a bot is scanning the code and creates pull requests
- Use your own stack and components
- Retain codebase ownership
You can get started here: [flycode.com/developers](https://www.flycode.com/developers)
## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
**[Nextra 2.0](https://nextra.site/)**

Nextra is a tool to facilitate the creation of documentation sites, based on Next.js, and created by a Vercel engineer. v2 has just been released with a great redesign and a nice list of features (MDX 2, Tailwind, search, i18n, a11y, code highlighting...). Relying on Next.js allows to benefit from a modern infrastructure and the latest Next.js innovations, but also to create more dynamic pages (SSR, ISR) associated to static documentation pages. It is a very serious competitor to [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/), the tool I am working on.

translations.zh-hant: Nextra æ˜¯åŸºæ–¼ Next.js çš„æ–‡ä»¶ç¶²ç«™å‰µå»ºå·¥å…·ï¼Œç”± Vercel å·¥ç¨‹å¸«é–‹ç™¼ã€‚v2 ç‰ˆå‰›ç™¼å¸ƒï¼Œå…·å‚™é‡å¤§é‡æ–°è¨­è¨ˆèˆ‡è±å¯ŒåŠŸèƒ½ï¼ˆMDX 2ã€Tailwindã€æœå°‹ã€i18nã€a11yã€ä»£ç¢¼é«˜äº®...ï¼‰ã€‚é€é Next.js å¯é‹ç”¨ç¾ä»£åŒ–åŸºç¤è¨­æ–½èˆ‡æœ€æ–°å‰µæ–°æŠ€è¡“ï¼ŒåŒæ™‚å»ºç«‹èˆ‡éœæ…‹æ–‡ä»¶é é¢é—œè¯çš„å‹•æ…‹é é¢ï¼ˆSSRã€ISRï¼‰ã€‚é€™æ˜¯æˆ‘æ­£åœ¨é–‹ç™¼çš„ [Docusaurus](https://docusaurus.io/) çš„å¼·åŠ›ç«¶çˆ­å°æ‰‹ã€‚

segments.source_content: [![Nextra 2.0](/emails/issues/127/nextra.jpg)](https://nextra.site/)
**[Inside React Query](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)**

Dominik explains how React-Query works, and details the relationships between its different elements: QueryClient, QueryCache, Query, Persister, QueryObserver... Many of these elements do not depend on React, and this is what allows TanStack Query to easily support other frameworks like SolidJS thanks to adapters.

translations.zh-hant: Dominik è§£æ React-Query çš„é‹ä½œåŸç†ï¼Œè©³è¿°å„å…ƒä»¶é–“çš„é—œä¿‚ï¼šQueryClientã€QueryCacheã€Queryã€Persisterã€QueryObserver... è¨±å¤šå…ƒä»¶ä¸ä¾è³´ Reactï¼Œä½¿ TanStack Query èƒ½é€éé©é…å™¨è¼•é¬†æ”¯æ´ SolidJS ç­‰å…¶ä»–æ¡†æ¶ã€‚

segments.source_content: [![Inside React Query](/emails/issues/127/react-query.png)](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/inside-react-query)
**[NextJS, SvelteKit, Remix and the future of Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/)**

Storybook 7.0 will have a new Framework API. It will allow the creation of "Framework packages" (example: `@storybook/nextjs`) that pre-configure your Storybook for a given stack (builder, renderer, app settings), and that you can extend. The support of several frameworks based on Vite is ready. Next.js and SvelteKit frameworks are coming soon, and a Remix support is considered.

translations.zh-hant: Storybook 7.0 å°‡æ¨å‡ºå…¨æ–°çš„ Framework APIã€‚å®ƒå…è¨±å»ºç«‹ã€Œæ¡†æ¶å¥—ä»¶ã€ï¼ˆä¾‹å¦‚ï¼š`@storybook/nextjs`ï¼‰ï¼Œé€™äº›å¥—ä»¶èƒ½ç‚ºæŒ‡å®šæŠ€è¡“å †ç–Šï¼ˆå»ºæ§‹å™¨ã€æ¸²æŸ“å™¨ã€æ‡‰ç”¨è¨­å®šï¼‰é å…ˆé…ç½® Storybookï¼Œä¸¦å¯é€²ä¸€æ­¥æ“´å±•ã€‚åŸºæ–¼ Vite çš„å¤šå€‹æ¡†æ¶æ”¯æ´å·²æº–å‚™å°±ç·’ï¼ŒNext.js å’Œ SvelteKit æ¡†æ¶å³å°‡æ¨å‡ºï¼ŒåŒæ™‚æ­£åœ¨è©•ä¼° Remix çš„æ”¯æ´æ–¹æ¡ˆã€‚

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ¿ [React.js - The Documentary - Trailer](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gmp0istg5xo): a documentary about React should be released in February. In the meantime you can check this 2min trailer. A nice list of guests have participated. I'm really looking forward to seeing this, and remembering the early years of React. This [parody](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ov0alO_k_1k) also made me laugh ;)
- ğŸ“– Beta docs: [useTransition](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598468389340585984) + [Suspense](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598412132827435008) + [useDeferredValue](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598414645244534784). We can sympathize with Dan Abramov who [dreams of documentation at night](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1598149838017003520) ğŸ˜… Glad this long effort is coming to an end.
- ğŸ“œ [Lessons learned: how Iâ€™d rebuild a social web app like Twitter today](https://paularmstrong.dev/blog/2022/11/28/lessons-learned-how-i-would-rebuild-twitter-today/): Paul worked on the Twitter web app. He wonders what choices he would make for it today. He would use Tailwind instead of React-Native-Web, which presents some pragmatic difficulties, and Twitter doesn't use React-Native so the cross-platform benefits are limited. He would also use a more reactive framework like SolidJS or Preact + Signals. Many other interesting points: Vite, Module Federation, Client Hints, Deno...
- ğŸ“œ [React vs React Native: How Different Are They, Really?](https://echobind.com/post/react-vs-react-native-how-different-are-they): details the many similarities and differences between React (DOM) and React-Native. A good resource for web developers who might be tempted to learn React-Native and want to know how much knowledge they will be able to reuse, but also for managers looking to understand what it takes to adopt React-Native.
- ğŸ“œ [Different Dimensions of Remix Deploy Targets](https://andre-landgraf.dev/blog/2022-12-03_different-dimensions-of-remix-deploy-targets): Remix can be deployed on different platforms, thanks to its adapters. This article analyzes each target platform along several dimensions and helps us to make an informed choice.
- ğŸ“œ [Component Testing in Storybook](https://bradfrost.com/blog/link/component-testing-in-storybook/): Brad Frost gives his positive opinion on the latest Storybook testing features presented in [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wEa6W8uUGSA). I also agree that Jest alone is not a suitable tool for visual rendering.
- ğŸ“œ [React Conditional Rendering With Type Safety and Exhaustive Checking](https://www.lloydatkinson.net/posts/2022/react-conditional-rendering-with-type-safety-and-exhaustive-checking/): React + TypeScript tip useful to know to make sure not to forget any case of an union-type (waiting for a real pattern matching support).
- ğŸ“œ [How we migrated from Redux to TanStack Query and Redux Toolkit](https://tech.storyly.io/how-we-migrated-from-redux-to-tanstack-query-and-redux-toolkit-ac9be2f445be): the story of 2 quite different projects based on Redux, and migrated incrementally to distinct solutions: RTK and React-Query.
- ğŸ“œ [Why you should reconsider prefetching in Remix](https://www.themosaad.com/blog/reconsider-prefetching-in-remix): an interesting reflection on the impact of a very fast but inconsistent navigation (ie sometimes slower without prefetching). I have a mixed opinion on the conclusion: we should be able to keep prefetching and make the UX consistent.
- ğŸ“œ [Add rolling sessions to Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/articles/add-rolling-sessions-to-remix)
- ğŸ“œ [The Children Prop Pattern in React](https://www.craftvalue.io/blog/react-children-prop-pattern)
- ğŸ¥ [TanStack Router: Type safe routing and URL state management for your applications](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qUZm3gbMOeo): Tanner presents his new 100% typesafe and agnostic router. I make the [same observation as him](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1555493419128168449): the existing APIs (Next.js, React-Router) do not facilitate the creation of apps that use query-strings a lot, and a new typesafe solution is welcome.
- ğŸ¥ [React Streaming In Depth! NextJS! Remix! DIY!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3JWb04DRIs): long video that details how streaming works with React, via the Next.js and Remix frameworks. Also offers a home-made implementation (not for production).
- ğŸ¥ [Remix - Roadmap Planning #1](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YSo0vKqAWtk): first public roadmapping session for the framework, as announced in [Open Development for Remix](https://remix.run/blog/open-development).
- ğŸ¥ [ChatGPT refactoring php + jquery to Next.js](https://twitter.com/thekitze/status/1598414259137880066): this new AI is impressive and has devs talking a lot this week on Twitter!
- ğŸ¨ [HTML + React-Three-Fiber demo](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1599367266448994304): cela semble de plus en plus facile, et performant, d'intÃ©grer du HTML dans une scene 3D avec React-Three-Fiber.
- ğŸ¦ [Nodejs.dev adopting Next.js?](https://twitter.com/ovflowd/status/1599417661242232832): the Node.js doc could migrate from Gatsby to Next.js
- ğŸ¦ [React Server Components + MDX](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1598615824927002624): the impact of RSC is potentially important for content sites using MDX, like Docusaurus or Nextra ;)
- ğŸ“¨ [React.holiday](https://react.holiday/): ephemeral avent newsletter of 25 short emails about new features of Next.js 13
- ğŸ“¦ [Papanasi 1.0](https://twitter.com/CKGrafico/status/1597585206034169857): v1 release of this innovative UI components library. It is based on [Mitosis](https://github.com/builderio/mitosis), which allows to compile code to all frameworks at once: React, Vue, Svelte, Solid...
- ğŸ“¦ [Jotai 1.11](https://twitter.com/jotaijs/status/1598366077527810048)
- ğŸ“¦ [Gatsby 5.2](https://www.gatsbyjs.com/docs/reference/release-notes/v5.2/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Redwood 3.5](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v3.5.0)

## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}

- ğŸ“Š [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/): Software Mansion is preparing a survey around React-Native and invites us to contribute to the questions asked: [2022 Call for Questions](https://github.com/software-mansion/state-of-react-native/discussions/1).
- ğŸ“¦ [Tamagui v1 Release Candidate](https://tamagui.dev/blog/version-one-release-candidate): Tamagui is a promising solution based on a compiler to style its React components in a universal way (mobile and web). The move to RC marks the stabilization of the APIs.

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**Product Engineer at Causal, Remote/London/NY, $150-250k**](https://jobs.lever.co/causal-app/4acaafbe-ef3d-45a6-bbe6-687c022d727c?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=thisweekinreact.com)

## ğŸ”€ Other {#other}
**[Updates from the 93rd TC39 meeting](https://dev.to/hemanth/updates-from-the-93rd-tc39-meeting-2n8f)**
Some very nice proposals for JavaScript have progressed last week, in particular:

- [Set Methods](https://twitter.com/robpalmer2/status/1597947853598785537) in stage 3: union, intersection, difference... ğŸ™Œ
- [Iterator Helpers](https://github.com/tc39/proposal-iterator-helpers) in stage 3: map, flatMap, filter, reduce...
- Intl APIs that continue to complement each other.
